About me

I am an assistant professor at Kellogg School of Management, Northwestern University.

My research develops and applies quantitative methods to improve marketing practice and product development. My research relies on field experiments and proof-of-concept studies with close industry collaborations. His recent work covers retail, financial services, automotive, and technology industries with a focus on marketing strategy, analytics and customer insights.

In my industry work, I collaborate with leading marketing solution providers and grocery retailers to design and implement advanced machine learning systems for scalable and automated marketing personalization. These marketing solutions have helped retailers to increase their revenue, return on advertising spend, and conversion rates.
